TopicTitle: [1.0.5] Adjustable Landing Gear v1.2.0 (mass/cost scaling, tech nodes, drag) - May 30

Articles.Content:
Hey +Baha, 3-4* things to report unsure if they've been mentioned, and do let me know if these are things you would need a log for or whatever, I'll provide whatever needed!

1) I have my plane's #1 Action Group set to "Taxi Mode", in which all 3 wheel's motors and the front wheel's steering will be toggled On. This works only until I raise and lower the landing gear. Even just sitting on the air-strip I can tap G in quick succession and suddenly the wheel's motors will stop working. However the steering still works.

-Gear's motors stop working after raising and lowering the wheels once.

2) Whenever the motors are working (aka when the plane spawns, before raising/lowering the gears) and I press W or S to run back/forth, the plane will not move in a straight line (unlike using the Stock game's landing gear or B9's); when I hold down W or S the plane will move forth and automatically steer to the left. NOTE: This also happens when I disable Dynamic Steering (whatever that is ).

-Craft will not taxi in a straight line using the landing gear's motors.

3) Whenever I'm inputting anything to the landing gear (i.e. holding W,A,S or D for motor-movement) my FPS suddenly drop and tank at what seems a solid 15 or 20 (maybe a little less or a little more, not entirely sure). I noticed this specifically whenever the "Taxi Mode" was On (all wheel's motors ON and front wheel's steering toggled).

-FPS Tank/Drop whenever the landing gear are receiving any kind of input on my end.

4*) Not sure if this is on purpose or an issue but going to mention it anyway just in case: Whenever I raise or lower the gear I hear a rather low pitch, slightly reverberated metallic 'Bonk' kinda noise. If it is on purpose I'd love to know what's actually making that noise Not knowing why would the gear produce that noise and hearing it every time I raise or lower them is very distracting xD Though of course I'm not demanding an explanation here, just would like to know if possible

Thanks again in advance for the reply and a ton for the mod and your time! And as I said, if you need a log of me going in game and reproducing all of these things I can do that, just let me know! Would love to know if I'm the only one experiencing this as it could be my game due to some other mod, not sure!

P.S.: The plane is making use of the F-22-eske cockpit and a few missiles and mini-gun. I believe those are all yours too correct?

4: I'm not sure what you mean by this, but wheel motors are just intended for taxiing your plane around the landing site/ksc, not for long cruises..

What I mean is: would it be possible to have the wheels be "throttled up" (providing constant force to move the plane forward) only so long as the W key is pressed? Not that the brakes would be applied if you let off W, but no more energy would be put into the system, as it were. A separate key could lock in the kind of "cruise control" that occurs now simply by holding W for a while and then subsequently not braking.

As things are now, it seems to operate like many wheels, meaning you press W and the "throttle value" is increased, and remains at the new level until something changes. Does that make any more sense (hopefully)? I may be the only one that prefers things this way, however.

Well, what can I say? They work. It's better than the alternative for sure, but is it possible to adjust their height? That's the issue with almost all landing gear is one size does not fit all. You can finagle these better but it still leaves one wanting.
